results.doc_title: CMA - Product & Engineering list (Source of truth, confidential)
results.purpose: Central source of truth for tracking Product & Engineering organization members within the Consumer Mega Alliance (CMA), including employee data, squad assignments, programming languages, and organizational structure
key_data_points: Employee assignments to squads and tribes

entities.name: Holger Hammel
entities.context: Primary contact for questions about the spreadsheet

entities.name: Workday
entities.context: Official source of truth for employee data and reporting lines

entities.name: Adaptive
entities.context: Secondary system with limited views, complemented by this spreadsheet

entities.name: Consumer Mega Alliance (CMA)
entities.context: The organizational unit being tracked, covering Product and Engineering

entities.name: CS8+ Tribe leads
entities.context: Responsible for keeping the sheet updated with status, dates, reporting, and squad assignments

insights: This is a confidential planning tool that supplements official HR systems (Workday/Adaptive) with additional operational data
Access is restricted to CS8+ level managers and above, indicating senior leadership use
The spreadsheet addresses a gap where managers need forward-looking planning capabilities and additional metadata not available in official systems
Multiple managers were creating similar tracking sheets independently, prompting centralization
There's an acknowledged synchronization challenge between Workday, Adaptive, and this sheet that remains to be resolved (marked as TBD)
The system uses filter views and pivot tables for analytics, suggesting it handles substantial organizational data
Squad assignments are auto-generated from main data to prevent manual editing errors
The tool tracks both active employees and those on garden leave with different visibility settings
